title: "GIScience Journal Assessment Dashboard"
subtitle: "Interactive Dashboard of publication trends in selected GIScience journals"
page-layout: full
---

We monitor key geographic information science (GIScience) journals to track the evolution of the field as well as to provide a resource for researchers in the GIScience community and related fields to optimize their publication strategies. The dashboard is based on the paper titled ["Assessing publication trends in selected GIScience journals"](https://doi.org/10.1080/13658816.2024.2347306).

::: {.callout-tip}
## Launch Dashboard
The dashboard is built with shinylive and it runs completely in your browser using WebAssembly. It may take a minute or so to load the R packages and data initially. Sinylive caches these resources efficiently so once everything is loaded, the dashboard should be responsive even during subsequent interactions.
:::

```{=html}
<div class="dashboard-container" style="position: relative; min-height: 1000px; background-color: #f8f9fa; border-radius: 4px;">
  <div id="dashboard-loader" style="position: absolute; top: 0; left: 0; width: 100%; height: 100%; background: #ffffff; z-index: 10; display: flex; flex-direction: column; align-items: center; justify-content: center; border-radius: 4px;">
    <div class="spinner-border text-primary" role="status" style="width: 3rem; height: 3rem;">
      <span class="visually-hidden">Loading...</span>
    </div>
    <div style="margin-top: 1.5rem; font-weight: 600; color: #0021A5; font-size: 1.2rem;">Initializing Dashboard...</div>
    <div style="font-size: 0.9em; color: #6c757d; margin-top: 0.5rem;">Downloading engine & data (first run ~30s)</div>
  </div>
  <iframe id="dashboard-frame" src="/resources/dashboard/index.html" width="100%" height="1000px" style="border:none; border-radius: 4px;"></iframe>
</div>

<script>
  document.addEventListener("DOMContentLoaded", function() {
    const iframe = document.getElementById('dashboard-frame');
    const loader = document.getElementById('dashboard-loader');
    
    // The iframe 'load' event fires when the initial HTML is fetched.
    // Shinylive then starts its own bootstrap process.
    // We keep our loader visible for a few seconds to cover the initial blank/white flash,
    // then let Shinylive's internal loader (or the app) take over if it's slow.
    // Ideally, we'd wait for a message from the iframe, but cross-origin/sandbox might limit that.
    
    iframe.onload = function() {
      // Keep loader for 2s to ensure the iframe has rendered its splash
      setTimeout(() => {
        loader.style.transition = 'opacity 0.5s ease';
        loader.style.opacity = '0';
        setTimeout(() => {
          loader.style.display = 'none';
        }, 500);
      }, 2000);
    };
  });
</script>
```
